title: morgana black shield wont block "quinn's" nearsighted

replies.body: it's not cc

> [{quoted}](name=Anastaecia,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=ENVAt0zr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-09-23T15:45:54.686+0000)
>
> it's not cc

Whoever categorized it as not being cc must have been nearsighted
Black sheild blocks 'spell effects' other than damage

Black Shield is a magic (damage) shield that negates cc as long as it holds. 

Nearsighted (which 4 champs apply) is not coded as cc, therefore BS doesn't negate Quinn.  CC is an arbitrary term which can be any combo of movement and ability impairing, which differs from game to game.  The only impairment that Nearsighted puts on you is the inability to use long ranged skills.  I guess Riot figured that wasn't a big enough category to really consider Nearsighted CC.

QSS does remove it (but nothing else will).  This does seems odd.

You all can downvote this too.  I am not agreeing one way or the other.  I am just explaining why it is the way it is based on the way RIot has everything set up.

It floats over your head just like "Stunned", "Slowed", etc.

Other than that, I can't really comment. I main Morg, but I haven't actually fought Quinn in a very long time.

This is a weird one since nearsighted only comes from 2(?) other sources that I can think of. Noct ult and Graves Smokescreen. For the other two Black Shield has no business blocking it because.. well it's a shield, it shouldn't magically make you see through smoke or pitch black environments.
The application of Quinn's is what makes it weird, because the way hers works absolutely should be blocked by a shield but because it's tagged the same as the other two it just doesn't.

the thing is physics doesn't apply to league. Like how you can blind lee sin, or how blitz can hook a target heavier than him over instead of getting pulled.
We all know lee sin isn't really blind. http://i.imgur.com/kQMO2uH.jpg

Just like logically a wall of wind can block an incoming rocket...or LIGHT, which literally makes no sense. Morg's black shield blocks all sorts of physical projectiles, so why would a small bird be different?
There are two other sources of nearsight which serve to muddle the matter further: Tahm Kench's devour and Rek'sai's Burrow.
I purposely left Rek Sai out since she can't do it to anyone but herself, but 100% forgot about Kench. Good catch there!

I agree with the Nocturne point but I disagree about it with Graves. It can block a sun beam from the heavens (Leona's ult) but it is completely ignored by a smoke grenade. It can ignore Cass's "on ground" effects, but what makes Graves smoke screen any different?  It can block Teemo's blind, but it can't block Nearsighted? 

The logic doesn't follow.

The logic is s solid though..
All those other things just hit you and have an effect. Smokescreen actually alters the environment around you. It surrounds you with smoke.
It doesn't poke out your eyes (Teemo and Quinn) cause that can be blocked by.. you know.. blocking, even in real life an actual shield would stop both of these attacks. It wouldn't even need to be a magical shield.

Now apply that same logic to being surrounded by a huge cloud of smoke. If Morgana provided Black Tac Goggles, then yeah maybe you can see through it, but that's not the case.
Why is Quinn in quotation marks?
I came here just to point that out
